Ravi Shankar, Who Brought Eastern Music To Western Legends, Dies
December 12, 2012 | NPR · When he was just 10 years old, Shankar began performing in Europe and the US with his family's Indian dance troupe. But at age 18, Shankar gave up all the glitter to study with a guru who taught him the sitar. He became a master, and introduced the West to his country's music.
